file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 21-60-08-02 - TORQUE-MOTOR DUAL VALVE - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TORQUE-MOTOR DUAL VALVE - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES EFFECTIVITY: POST-MOD. S.B. 145-21-0039 1. General A. The air filter is installed on the line that connects the relief valve to the torque motor in the Torque- Motor Dual Valve (TMDV) assembly which is part of the ECU. The filter element can be discarded and replaced when necessary. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY POST-MOD. S.B. TORQUE-MOTOR DUAL-VALVE FILTER - 21-60-08-960-801-A ♦ 145-21-0039 REPLACEMENT EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 21-60-08 Page 1 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-60-08-960-801-A EFFECTIVITY: POST-MOD. S.B. 145-21-0039 2. TORQUE-MOTOR DUAL-VALVE FILTER - REPLACEMENT A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to replace the TMDV air filter element. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - IPC 21-51-00 COOLING PACK SYSTEM C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 191 191KL LH side of the forward lower fairing 191 191LR RH side of the forward lower fairing D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially 5/8” wrench To secure the flange. 1 available Commercially Torque wrench - 0 - 10 N.m (0 - 88 lb.in) To attach the air filter body to the flange. 1 available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MS20995C20 Lockwire AR G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Torque-Motor Dual-Valve Air Filter IPC 21-51-00 1 H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task LH or RH side of the forward lower fairing EMB-145 - AMM 1285 960-801-A/200 21-60-08 Page 2 of 4 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Remove access panel 191KL or 191LR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). J. Air Filter Element Replacement (Figure 201) SUBTASK 960-002-A (1) Remove the lockwires (5). (2) Disconnect the tube assembly from the lower end of the air filter body (6). (3) Loosen and remove the air filter body (6). Use a 5/8" wrench to secure the flange (1) in place. NOTE: • Use the 5/8" wrench to prevent the flange loosening. • Make sure do not lose the spring (2). (4) Discard the filter element (4) and O-ring (3). (5) Install a new filter element (4) in the air filter body (6). (6) Install a new O-ring (3) in the flange (1). (7) Install the spring (2) and the air filter body (6) on the flange (1). (8) Tighten the air filter body (6) on the flange (1). With a torque wrench, apply a torque of 5 - 6 N.m (44 - 53 lb.in). (9) Connect the tube assembly to the lower end of the air filter body (6). Tighten the connection. (10) Install the new lockwires (5). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install access panel 191KL or 191LR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 960-801-A/200 21-60-08 Page 3 of 4 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
